column1: 1 ^ Beátus vìr qŭi non abívit in consìlio impiórum
column2: et in via peccatórum non stètit
column3: et in catédra pestilènțiaĕ non sêdit
column4: ^ Blessed is the man who hath not gone in the counsel of the ungodly
column5: nor stood in the way of sinners
column6: nor sat in the chair of pestilence

column1: 2 ^ sed in lege Dòmini volùntas ejus
column2: et in lege ejus meditábitur die ac nòcte. ^ but his will is in the law of the Lord
column3: and on his law he shall meditate day and night.

column1: 3 ^ Et èrit tamqŭam lìgnum qŭod plantátum est sècus decùrsûs aqŭárum
column2: qŭod fructum suum dabit in tèmpore suo
column3: et fólium ejus non défluet. Et òmnia qŭaĕcùmqŭe fáciet prosperabùntur. ^ And he shall be like a tree which is planted near the running waters
column4: which shall bring forth its fruit in due season
column5: and his leaf shall not fall off. And all whatsoever he shall do shall prosper.

column2: non sic~; sed tamqŭam pùlvis qŭem prójicit vèntus a fácie terraĕ. ^ Not so the wicked
column3: not so; but like the dust which the wind driveth from the face of the earth.

column1: 5 ^ Ìdeo non resùrgent ìmpii in judìcio
column2: nèqŭe peccatóres in concìlio justórum~; ^ Therefore the wicked shall not rise again in judgment
column3: nor sinners in the council of the just;

column2: et ìter impiórum períbit. ^ for the Lord knoweth the way of the just
column3: and the way of the wicked shall perish.
